header.div: Posted by Kristaps Dzonsons on 29 June, 2013

article.p: sblg will generate Atom feeds when given the -a flag. These are used for syndication (I guess – I've never used it). All you need to do is provide an Atom template; the entry, updated, and id (the id field must occur after the link) fields will be automatically filled in.
This site has a dummy atom.xml for Each of this page's articles.

Filled-in entries consist of title, id, updated, author, and alternate link elements. If specified in the original article, a summary element will consist of an HTML article summary. See the sblg(1) manual for details.
Remember to link to the feed in your blog-template.xml or article-template.xml file!
